medical_history.chief_complaint: Abdominal pain and fluid in the peritoneal cavity.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Abdominal pain developed suddenly on the morning of admission, rated at 10 on a scale of 1 to 10, sharp and constant, associated with nausea but not vomiting. The pain increased with movement and when in a supine position, radiating to the right flank. Pain persisted and increased approximately 5 hours after arrival at the hospital.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Asthma, appendectomy as a child, treated with low-molecular-weight heparin due to pleuritic chest pain episodes, normal prenatal care initiated 1 month before admission, and Rh immune globulin administered 4 weeks prior to admission.
medical_history.family_history: Mother deceased from cervical cancer; father and siblings are healthy; no family history of blood clots.
medical_history.social_history: Patient was unemployed, lived with an aunt in Boston for several years. Did not consume alcohol, smoke, or use illicit drugs.
